intro: Chrysosplenium japonicum f. tetrandrum, commonly known as the Japanese stonecrop, is a low-growing perennial plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Saxifragaceae family and is characterized by its compact rosette of fleshy, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in rocky or woodland habitats. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for rock gardens and shaded landscapes.
